summary: Build a Google-like website (search homepage style).

existing_features.title: Create a Google-inspired search homepage UI with a centered logo, a prominent search input, and primary/secondary action buttons (e.g., “Search” and “I’m Feeling Lucky”), using only original branding (no Google trademarks, fonts, or logos).

Implement a search results page that displays a list of results for the entered query, including a result title, a URL/host line, and a short snippet per result; results may be generated from a local mock dataset and filtered client-side.
Add basic search UX behaviors: pressing Enter triggers search, the search box supports clearing/editing, and the query is reflected in the URL so results can be refreshed/bookmarked.

Apply a coherent visual theme across the app (colors, typography, spacing, button styles) with a clean minimalist aesthetic that evokes a modern search engine while remaining clearly non-identical to Google’s visual design (avoid the exact Google color palette and styling).
Add the generated static images to the frontend as assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them in the UI (logo on the homepage and optionally a small logo in the results header).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a Google-like website (search homepage style).

imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Minimalist abstract search logo mark with clean geometric shapes, neutral palette (search-logo.dim_512x512.png)
- Wide horizontal version of the same logo/wordmark style with original text (not 'Google'), clean typography (search-logo-wide.dim_1200x300.png)

generatedImages.description: Minimalist abstract search logo mark with clean geometric shapes, neutral palette
Wide horizontal version of the same logo/wordmark style with original text (not 'Google'), clean typography

projectName: Build a Google-like search homepage and results UI
